result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Stowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Sentence may be served in another county, if it can be arranged and at no additional costs to Green Lake County.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Stowe

1:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  FTP $443.00.  Statement by defendant - can pay when he gets done sitting his sentence and needs to go to Waushara County.  Defendant to contact the COC office to set up a payment plan with a 6 month review to see if defendant has contacted us.  If no contact - warrant is to be issued.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.
FTP Hearing 02-22-2016 for $443.00

10:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will enter a plea and resolve this matter.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1, and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Corut orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-15 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Out -of county service.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:45 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-12-2015 10:00 am

10:44 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has not been able to make contact with the defendant and requests a hearing.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 12, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.  Defendant's appearance is mandatory or warrant will be issued.

Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 10:00 am

2:40 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer that was sent to the defendant last week, but has not heard if he is accepting it or not.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:50 p.m.
(State's)
By Atty Barb Privat
Defendant's
Defendant's
Status hearing at 07-21-2015 02:00 pm

1:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - represents the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on July 21, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
Status hearing at 06-15-2015 01:00 pm

3:40 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 3:40 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing at 06-08-2015 01:00 pm
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privet.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 8, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
